message:
First, from this description, there's nothing CPU-bound that the code is doing. So there should be a straightforward way to do this without BGW or Task.Run at all.

In general, you can start an async operation by just calling the method and not doing an await right away; instead, just save the Task in a variable and await it later (possibly using Task.WhenAll or Task.WhenAny).

That same strategy can be used with Task.Run, but again it sounds like there would be a better solution without Task.Run or BGW at all.
